review_blob: Decent porter. Not as much vanilla as i would like but still good. Lots of coffee and some chocolate caramel. A little but of metallic tinge to it but still decent porter.
Wow this is crazy hoppy. Lots of citrus pith and quinine. Slightest touch of cocoa bitters as well. Ok.
This does have the distinct smell of ginger. Very sweet and floral. It has theyaste of ginger beer. It is almost like a soda. Nice and light

Smells of hop flowers and spruce with a hint of something sweet. The taste is initially sweet but then the overpowering lemon pith coats your entire mouth. Lots of aspirin. Celery. Good but just too much for me to really enjoy the beer.
Ok. Decent flavor but nothing to write home about. Easy drinking but really uneventful.
Very dark molasses and caramel malts. Sweet and nutty. Notes of coffee as well with good chocolate highlights.
Smells of banana and oatmeal. Straw. Decent sweetness but then again great hops presence too. Cinnamon. Pretty good actually
Smells of cocoa and coffee. Nice and malty. Coffee notes and bitter chocolate. Very nice.
beer_name: Left Coast Voo Doo American Stout

review_blob: Smells of sweet malt. Has almost a carameled apple flavor. Nice and sweet but not overly so. Floral. Actually quite nice.
beer_name: Left Coast Del Mar St. Export Lager

review_blob: This is a decent amber. Copper in color and good light malts. Easy to drink.

A little apprehensive at first but surprised at how mich better it tasted. Smells of skink but the flavor is nice. Smooth and slightly sweet. I was told that there is rich added which helps to round out and smooth the beer. Most people would buy for the bottle but I wouldnt mind this being an everday drinking beer.
Coriander and spice in the nose. Lemon and tart green apple. Good. This one is really tart and then kind of disappears.
Dark brown ale. No head. Smells of hops and molasses. Honey. Rye bread and good floral notes. Lighter than i thought it would be. Very good.

Black. No head. I just poured and from three feet away all i smell is vanilla. Maybe somesweet toffee or caramel too. Same in flavor. Great notes of sweet vanilla caramel before a mouthful of espresso. Really nice stout. Good balance between sweet and bitter
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Creme Brulee Stout

review_blob: Smells of sweet hops and light lemon. Dark orange color with white thin head. Floral notes from the hops. Good bitter grapefruit pith only. Slightly tinny but light and kind of refreshing.

Nice dark cola color with settling creamy off white head. Smells of caramel and prune. Maybe a little touch of coriander. May sound funny but I feel like I smell graham crackers too. Lighter bodied than I thought it would be with sawdust and dark fruit some coffee and even pepper. Very different.
Looks awesome. Dark black with inch tall cream head. Smells like sweet molasses and coffee. Lighter in body than i thought. Sawdust and espresso with very light whipped cream. Nice
beer_name: Anderson Valley Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: Had this on on tap at Roses in East Grand Rapids. Good citrus notes with plenty of hops. Clowdy amber color. Easy drinker
Almost black brown with thin tan head. Smells of coffee and sweet toffee. Smokey and nutty with definite espresso notes. Bitter cocoa.
Dark black beer with tan head that disappeared almost immediately. Smells of heavy black caramel, coffee, chocolate, and raisin. Rich smokey, coffee ground, bitter cocoa. Almost herbal. Good.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Bourbon Barrel Aged Siberian Night

review_blob: Foamy tan head with black thick body. Smells of chocolate and cereal and dark carmel riesen candy. Very rich with espresso and chocolate bitters. Caramel and roasted malt. Very nice.
From the can so a little tinny. Dark black with tan head that disappears quickly. Chocolate and coffee. Smooth but not as smooth as some Ive had lately.
Had this on Tap from Tim at Pietros in Grand Rapids. Awesome beer. Super creamy, filled sith coffee notes and chocolate.

Copper color body, half inch offwhite seafoam head. Total grapefruit nose. A little lemon to start but quickly overtaken by the bitter hops until all it is is aspirin. Slightly floral but really mostly bitter with notes of pine resin.
Dark black with creamy foam head. Smells of coffee and chocolate. Very rich and nutty. Espresso and caramel. A little vanilla. Heavy.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: UPDATED: APR 15, 2014
Nice dark brown with foamy tan head. Smells of chocolate malt but has that banana smell too. Smokey but very tinny. Good bitter finish. A little coffee to end it. Lighter body here
beer_name: Stillwater Sensory Series v.2 - Small Black

review_blob: Dark reddish brown beer with quarter inch tan head. Smells of molasses and raisin. Odd and almost sickly sweet. Floral finish, Smooth but not at all what I was expecting. I thought it would be more hops forward. It seems a bit more malty for me. Kind of one dimensional. Definitely has alcohol though.

Piss yellow color. Thin foamy white head.  No depth to the nose. I will admit that it is a little cold still but I have nothing at all except very faint banana.  Smoky metallic flavor. Very tinny. Dry and grassy as well. Not my kind of Belgian but it isnt Belgian is it. Definitely falls short.

Given to me by my beer distributor. The labels definitely look homemade. The beer is rose to amber with little to no head. Smells tinny, raisin, fig maybe? Definitely different. Nutty leading to a sour feeling and then a dry cardboard feel. Odd. This one is hard to place for me. I get some leather and earth but that tart sourness gets me. Very different. I still feel the cardboard a lot.

nice pale gold amber color. Smells immediately of hops but there is a slight sweetness there too. Slight citrus as well. Nice light flavor in the initial taste and then nice bitterness and grapefruit peel in the finish. Long flavor there. Nice and easy to drink.

Bells Expedition Stout is one of my favorite beers so I am looking forward to this one. 

Black beer with nice tan/brown head. Very light nose, chocolate and coffee definitely, almost nutty, some sawdust perhaps, quite dry. I can tell its too cool at this point.

Now more coming from the nose, deeper coffee, along with toffee, caramel, burnt toast?

Begins slightly sour in the mouth, some raisin, some other dark fruits, leading to a bitter dry finish with coffee.  No heavy alcohol but it definitely lights up the glands in the back of the mouth.

I was expecting deeper flavor but it is very drinkable and I am excited that I was given two of these by the distributor.
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Siberian Night Imperial Stout

review_blob:
Nice orange apple cider color beer with yellow halo. Thin white frothy head. Smeels deep with sweet caramel, apple peel, malt, slight hint of smoke.

Smoky and earthy, leading to a very dry finish, probably all contributed from the whiskey barrels. Orange peel in the finish perhaps. No sweetness that was hinted from in the nose. 

Wow...now extra bitter mouth. Nice.

Beer Rep! Kind of rust color through the black instead of black. I dont like that.Smells  better. Nice and malty, chocolatey, nutty,molasses. Light but very nice. It tastes good and is accessible. Sort of thin for 5.7%. Not best porter, a little sour and blah but OK.

Another decent beer from Avery. Yellow, peach color. Frothy white head. Smells of banana, coriander, syrupy sweet malts, bubble gum. Easy to drink, light, pick up a little bit of orange peel. Smooth and satisfying.
Orange Amber fall like color. Very thin white head. Smells very sour, like yogurt, faint sweet malt. Very sour beer, dry, earthy. I almost find it to be like a gueze, maybe a flemish brown ale.
Nice golden ale with marshmallowy white head loaded with bubbles. Coriander, banana, apricot. Hoppy. Nice bitterness, quite dry, a little tinny. Warming immediately in the cheeks and back of throat.

Cloudy pale gold pils, thin white spittle looking head, lacing. Smells of earth and egg, some grass. Bitter draw but very settling in the mouth. Nice mouthfeel, cool and slightly bitter again in the finish. Very easy drinking and could be a gateway beer to other microbrews.
beer_name: Heavy Seas Small Craft Warning ber Pils

review_blob: Another cheap beer that I bought to sell on college night and had to try because I never had. Gold with hint of rose in there. Thin cream head. Really almost non existent. Same general smell as the Labatts Classic but perhaps a hint of malt. Dry nose, some grass. Decent flavor, a little tinny, a slight sweetness in the finish to a strange sour aftertaste in the back of the mouth. Some floral notes, almost gritty, if that makes sense. OK but not something that I would order for myself.

I just rated the Beer 30 and sad to say this looks eerily similar. Dry sweetness in the nose. Still picking up corn. Hope this isnt indicative of the flavor. Taste is a little bit better, more of a sweetness, syrup even. Some grassy qualities. Reminds me of some now defunct Kraftbrau beers.

Bought this for college night. $1 beers. Smells like corn, sweet and sugary. That hurts the nose. Looks like urine a day after heavy drinking. Tastes completely awful. The general sourness, the evil coating of the tongue. I have to pour the rest out. I cannot drink it. And worst of all the colors on the can are god awful.

Sample from Imperial. 
Definite rusty amber color with frothy cream head. Smells malty. A little bit of grass perhaps. Vanilla, toffee in the nose. Different flavor. Carries in the roof of the mouth, smooth and sweet. A little bit of Christmas in there I think. Dry finish , not a hint of hops. Slightly tinny.

Nice and dark brown/black with nice tan head. Smells of deep dark malts, nuts, molasses, coffee, chocolate. The taste is that of a mocca espresso. Nice and nutty in the finish. Sensational beer. The finish is long and very coffeesque. Wonderful wonderful stuff. It is complex yet simple.

Slight cold so I cannot smell that well.  Perhaps some lemon zest and coriander. I think you can taste the hibiscus actually, a little tangy, dry in the finish. OK. This will do the trick after working one crazy St Patricks Day at the Union.

Deep cola colored beer with think foamy off white head. I smell cinnamon and chocolate at first pass, a little coffee in the second, perhaps some caramel. This is pretty sweet and has a nice bitter finish on the tip of the tongue and back of the roof of the mouth. Medium to long finish. Caramel molasses flavors, slightly syrupy. A little more carbonation than I would prefer, but I definitely pick up some coffee notes in the flavor that I enjoy.  There is a present sourness, but not offending.

Stephanie from Paw Paw brought me this one. Nice black beer with a foamy tan head. Smells of sweet molasses, and smoke, perhaps a little coffee, slight coriander. 
Very nice flavor, a little bit of a syrupy sweetness as well as smoothness. Very short finish. Slight tinny flavor.
Very drinkable but a little one dimensional. I really was expecting more from this one

PPWD Show. Started the beer tasting side of this show (from the wine side first) with the gueuze which is a good transition I must say. Very naked and sour. Quite nice but not a session beer of course.  Oh that bite.
PPWD Show. Not as nice as the blue stripe so doesnt stand out as well in my mind. I do remember it was quite drinkable but will have to drink it again to really remember and note its hightlights.
beer_name: Gouden Carolus Cuvee Van De Keizer Rood/Red

review_blob:
PPWD Show. 
This was the 2008 Vintage. I would love to try one a bit older. Probably the best beer that I tried at the show. Again a little bit too cold but was able to warm in hand. Excellent beer and this as well I would like to try blind against Chimay Blue one of my favorites. Sweet dark dried fruits, some chocolate, hint of coffee and quite dry. Excellent beer.
beer_name: Gouden Carolus Cuvee Van De Keizer Blauw/Blue

review_blob: PPWD Show. Excellent beer. What can I say I love the Belgians. A little cold. Had to warm in hand. Comparable to Chimay White. Would like to taste them side by side, blind. Obvious banana, bubble gum, coriander. Good mouthfeel. Light finish. Cant believe its 11%.
